Posts.Content: WCElliot,  How are you? Good job explaining apoptosis. I hope it helped someone. And yes it's not like (poisoning) cancer cells (all cells,in fact),with chemo/rad.,which is foolish considering that "cancer" cells are already damaged and for the most part (resist) these toxins anyways. There are so many effective natural,non-toxic chemotherapeutic agents available (that can't be patented),like Turmeric (curcumin) and Grape seed extract,or better yet grape juice and wine. These flavonoids,like all flavonoids,are potent inducers of apoptosis,among other things. Another polyphenol in wine,(resveritrol) has been called one of the most potent (effective) anti-cancer compounds known. These (medicines) will re-establish the apoptosis mechanism within cancer cells, so they can naturally self-destruct on their own, and without damage to healthy cells....Malignant melanoma? No problem! (easy for me to say) Conventional medicine (can't) heal this melanoma but real medicine can! (medicinal plants and foods),unless you know someone who makes better medicine than GOD. If it were me? Olive oil !!!(omega-9 PUFAs) Olive oil is a "wonderdrug" and "pharmacodynamic". What cant't it do. I'd use it (on) my body and (in) my body, and as much as I could naturally handle. And fish oils (omega-3s).Potent medicines! We already have too much (omega-6) in our diets,which actually encourage the malignancy process and/or carcinogenesis through chronic (pathological) inflammation. Omega 9 and 3s fix that problem, and so much more. And OILS facilitate the assimilation of the many fat soluble constituents found in Curcumin and anything else you are using.I'd be interested in knowing what else you are doing,maybe I could add my 2cents worth and help in some way. Malignant melanoma is no joke,however,and must be addressed with a well-rounded (comprehensive) treatment plan, to cover ALL the bases, which is simple to do! If you want send me a (private or public) reply outlining your treatment plan (what you are using,how much and how often), in ten words or less,ha just kidding.   Sincerely   dave
Posts.Title: Grapeseed Extract induces apoptosis in Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: spunkypb,      You have been through ALOT. I say (through),because you'll get through it,all. Anybody named "spunky" is an overcomer! And your (attitude) does determine your altitude. Arimidex, in case you were wondering,inhibits the enzyme that converts androgens to estrogen. But the body requires estrogen. Blocking it's normal synthesis in the body seems foolish,to me, and results in osteoporosis, osteonecrosis (bone death),heart disease and who knows what else...I'm just saying.  The better way to go is (putting) natural estrogens,plant estrogens (phytoestrogens) into the body to competitively inhibit the synthetic estrogens and other estrogenic chemicals (found in everything from plastics to perfumes), and which are the real culprits in breast and other cancers, because they cause unregulated/accelerated cellular proliferation and tumor growth. Natural estrogens don't do that! I wouldn't use soy, probably the most genetically modified plant on the planet.I'd go with Red clover, which actually has more phytoestrogens than soy. In fact, as you may or may not know, ALL green plants contain phytoestrogens, so juicing greens is excellent for breast cancer. Oatmeal, flaxseed, turmeric, fish oil all have their place, and are good choices.I'd put yogurt and yeast with the oatmeal. All excellent healers of the GI tract. 60 percent, it is said, of your immune system is in your bowls. Healthy, functioning bowls dramatically boost your immune system...Co-enzyme Q10 (ubiquinone) is made in the body from amino acids, B vitamins (yeast being one of the richest sources of B-vitamins and amino acids),and vitamin E. In fact CoQ10 is similar in structure to Vit E. CoQ10 is found in high amounts in fish oils, which you use, Olive oil (up to 160mg/kg, which might be the highest),meats, and greens like broccoli and spinach, both very good for breast cancer. CoQ10 the "supplement" may or may not work, in my opinion. I hope some of this was helpful. Successfully treating breast cancer is simple. A well-rounded plan, is the key. I'd be glad (honoured) to help you in any way I can... I wish you the best outcome.  And if it's ok with you, I want to pray for you. You need the prayers and I need the practice.        Sincerely       Dave

Posts.Content: motherofpatient,    Hi, I don't (assume) anyone is an idiot until they prove otherwise. But you think I'm peddling BS. I guess I'm not talking to (you) then. Thats too bad. What I say speaks for itself, check it out! You win, I don't have any "degrees", I'm self-taught, as in, the experts write books...I study these books...and eventually (over 20 years), I have the knowledge of the experts...and so on. But don't get me wrong, I have nothing against "schooling", as long as it dosn't get in the way of your education. And thinking for yourself, instead of being told what to think, is actually a good thing!   You've been told that "ER cancers feed off estrogen" So that's what you believe. But if you could make a distinction between natural estrogens and synthetic estrogens (or estrogenic chemicals that act like estrogen), THEN, you'd be closer to the truth. Natural estrogens DON'T cause cells (cancer cells) to grow out of control. Synthetic estrogens DO!  I hope that was helpful. Sincerely  Dave.

Posts.Content: Water-based extracts of (three mushroom species) were identified as new anti-breast cancer agents. Mushroom extracts induced an exceptionally rapid apoptosis on breast cancer cells within 2 hours of treatment. (Apoptosis means, cancer cells self-destruct without damage to healthy cells) "Results suggest that these mushroom species contain potent antitumor compounds for breast cancer" "Our finding is important due to the lack of chemotherapeutic agents (drugs) for ER-human breast cancer" Oncology Reports  (Journal), 2006 Feb;15(2a),417-23 Sincerely    dave

Posts.Content: Dgirl,     Hi, If you're patient you might get (some) good advice on this board, but I havn't really seen anything yet. Of course there are successful "alternative" treatments for breast cancer. But unless you understand what something is, and what it does, you could waste alot of time. In my opinion, Oldaxe has the best idea so far,but why cook it (or zap it), and change it's properties? It will at least help to get your pH balanced. And the plant-based diet, is no doubt,what is helping tina59. And the lectins (in mistletoe injections) are found in many good sources, like flaxseed. You don't have to go to Europe for that. And Rexin-G? I read the website, and as far as I can tell, it has something to do with genetic material from a rat virus, with an enzyme, in a "nanoparticle". And the rest read like an episode of Star Wars, in my opinion. Maybe someone can help me out here. Dr. Lorraine Day, just posted by lsmith, (is) a good place to start!    Wish you the best,    sincerely   Dave
Posts.Title: Are there any stage IV breast cancer survivors thru alternative treatments????

Posts.Content: Did you know that taxotere and taxol etc. come from the Yew tree/shrub (taxus),originally.Taxotere is the man-made version of,one of,the Yew's original medicinal compounds,which is a terpene compound that works as an estrogen agonist/antagonist.The original medicine,however,in its original state actually works,without the side effects.I'm sorry to hear what you have been through."cancer" comes back or never really left,because the real reason for it (a breakdown of the body's chemistry) has yet to be addressed.  And repairing the body's chemistry is actually quite simple. Steroids are given to suppress your immune system,so you dont have a serious or deadly allergic reaction to the taxotere....How can you successfully address cancer without an immune system?

Posts.Content: On Feb 05, 2011 2:11 AM JoyceJJL wrote: Dave I know you are trying to help alot of us, by mentioning that the hemo etc  etc kills the good cells, and reduces our immune system a great deal.  However, unless you have been through this and are at a point that its either try the chemo and go into remission and or get it out of your sytem for a time, one never knows what they would do until faced with that decision. I always swore I would never have my breasts removed or do chemo,.  But if I didnt I wouldnt be here typing.  I know on your name you fully believe in Hollistic, and I am sure people could probably purchase it from you.  Which is all well and good IF they want to go that route and many do,. However I am one that did what I said I never would, and would do it again.  I guess its the old "cliche" to each their own.  I am just saying I did try the chem and they do tell you what its doing to you and its up to me or anyone else who chooses that route whether or not to do the chemo through your system,  I am only saying my perspective as well as you did yours.  I respect yours, so Please respect those of us who choose the opposite.  Thanks Joyce Dear Joyce...I mean no disrespect.I share my point(s) of view because I care.It 's the needless suffering that I find offensive.People are taught to fear cancer,but the real fear is the fear of the unknown (and probably the fear of chemo/rad.), because if people really knew how readily cancer cells/tumors respond to non-toxic chemotherapies there would be alot less room for fear,and alot less suffering. (Who said chemotherapy had to be toxic?) Because "conventional medicine" is dishonest most people don't have a good understanding of how treatable any cancer is without chemo/rad.And to me,that's disgusting...Difficult decisions and difficult situations have a way of creating depth in a person,and I only wish you the best!        Sincerely, Dave

Posts.Content: On Feb 06, 2011 3:38 PM Diamond2Wheels wrote: Had a mastectomy 4/2010 of left breast with flesh and some muscle - The cancer returned this time with a vengance!  It has inhabited under my arm pit to almost the last rib on left side through the center and onto the right breast.  It feels as if I have been wearing a underwire bra that is restricting me to breathe!  I can not sleep at night because I must sleep on my back and the shoulderblade feels burning hot and often times itchy with so much pain that the Oxy's of any kind do not work! I'm stage 4 (withing 2 months) during my clinical trial which I was not treated very well. I would ask the doctor a question and the clinical trial nurse would be in the room and blurt out, she is PROTOCOL only!  Needless to say, I thought Doctors had to take an oath? None of my questions were answered and then they kicked me off the clinical trial and never told me why! Is there any way to get a good nights sleep?  Does massage help or hurt?  What about heating pads??? I know they take away the bodys electrolites.... Please help...I'm in desperate need.   Diamond2Wheels ,   What kind of help or advice are you looking for, conventional or alternative?   How does a heating pad take away electrolytes? I don't think that should be a problem.  Sincerely dave
